messages.title: UKIP says YES to
messages.content: An NHS free at the point of delivery; No tax on the minimum wage; Housing priority for local people; Affordable energy

messages.title: UKIP says NO to
messages.content: Unlimited immigration; £55m a day membership fees to the EU; £12 billion a year in foreign aid; The 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supports an NHS that is free at the point of delivery, proposes an additional £3 billion in funding.
Ensures that those on minimum wage do not have to pay income tax.
Gives priority to local people for social and low-cost housing.
Prioritizes investment in affordable energy from sources like shale gas and nuclear, and is against oversubsidized wind and solar farms.
Promotes a stance against unlimited immigration.
Opposes the £55 million a day membership fees to the EU.
Wants to reduce the £12 billion a year spent on foreign aid.

issues.brexitEurope: Opposes £55m a day membership fees to the EU; views the EU as the past, not the future.
issues.economy: Against 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax'; advocates for simpler tax and welfare systems.
issues.environment: Against oversubsidized wind and solar farms; prefers investment in shale gas and nuclear energy.
issues.health: Increases NHS funding by £3 billion; promotes NHS free at the point of delivery.
issues.socialWelfare: Against 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax'; calls for fairer tax and welfare systems.

housing.content: Prioritizes local people for social and low-cost housing to help local youngsters get on the property ladder.

contactInformation.address: UKIP, Lexdrum House, King Charles Business Park, Newton Abbot TQ12 6UT.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet criticizes the Labour and Conservative parties, particularly concerning their handlings of the NHS and taxation.
